40922140.review:
The original Spooky's Mansion was a pleasant surprise for me when I first tried it, and one of my favourite creepy games, so much so I bought the DLC! so when I see there is a new HD version with VR support?! BOY! I HAD TO GET IT!

It's the exact same game as the original, but with VR support and crisper textures, the game also has kept the silky smooth framerate of the original and some of the 2D enemies have been replaced with 3D models which look nice, but an option to choose between the 3D versions or the classic 2D ones would have been nice, although I'm not too fussed.

The Katamari Hospital DLC is also included here, so if you loved that? well you'll be happy with this. Overall there is not much more I can say about the HD version since it's essentially the same game, but it definitely looks nicer, and the VR support is always welcomed!

40909344.review:
The story is really creepy and cute at most aspects. Compare to the original version, this renewed version actually worth to buy. Mostly all Specimen become high detailed, get fixes for their most bugs and unintended mechanics, the dev also provides some of the unknown ones with brand new introduction rooms in endless mode of the game. Karamari Hospital DLC is included in the game just as all the monsters there which can be encountered in endless mode as well. The health regeneration after taking damage is significantly high. All the Specimen got their righteous balance changes unlike the ones in the original game. The atmosphere in both the original story and in Karamari Hospital are very similar. The game has got rich with additional rooms with tricky dead ends, especially if the player is chased by an illusionist or manipulative kind of Specimen. Sometimes when you encounter a Specimen after the first time, the music does not play. This way you can be attacked without warning. I don't know if it's a bug, but it actually gives you a hard time to be aware from any Specimen. All types of Specimen monsters require a unique strategy to escape. If some of those are chasing you at once, you really need to improvise and keep them in bay by react enough fast to their movement and behavior. Later on, this game is going to be updated with a brand new map editor and Specimen creator which just sounds as promising as how awesome the updates were this far. I hardly can wait!

 I love this game and I recommend it to most of horror genre loving gamers.

40015817.review:
[i]tldr: The original is free on Steam give it a go and if you like it and want to support the devs and play Karamari get this[/i]

This is by far one of my favorite indie horror games ever made. I originally found this game on gamejolt back before it was finished and decided to give it a go. I then completed the 1.0 version of the game when it was released. When this came out I immediately picked it up.
First off this is not the original game, you can still play that one for free on steam if you'd like to try the game on its old engine. This game however is a complete remaster of the game done in Unity which makes it look a lot less like DOOM and more like a proper 3D game. It also added multiple improvements to the core game as well.
This game starts out rather lighthearted but over time grows more and more frightening. While all of the different monsters in the game are rather predictable and easy to figure out that doesn't mean it's not terrifying to meet each one for your first playthrough.
The game's story is rather bland but the descriptions and info based around the spooky inhabitants you'll meet are quite well written. Each one was awesome to discover and go up against in their own charming way. Not to mention that there is some truly terrifying moments in this game, and I usually don't get spooked by stuff even with all the horror games I play.
I highly recommend this game to all people who love horror and I can easily give it an 9/10.

I also somewhat like the fact two specimens can chase you at once in EM. Some combinations like Specimen 2, Specimen 4 (second form), and Monster 2 would be a pretty challenging combo. Though, I feel like some combinations can be a liitle too rough, such as Lisa, Bekka, and Specimen 4 (second form). But hey, its endless mode!
I don't have too many cons. The game has them, but I have yet to locate them. One con is I feel like some of the themes of some of the specimens are broken. But thats about it. Otherwise, I love this game!

38422010.review:
Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion is a fantastic horror game. Each of the games numerous (and creative) monsters have their own separate room to house them until you show. Then they.... well, they chase you. 

The game consists of walking into randomly generated rooms, discovering the secrets of a haunted mansion. Monsters will show up and chase you through the vast labrynth at random to keep you hurrying through the mansion and make it to its 1000th room. The sheer stress of walking into a new room and remembering that a monster could pop up at any moment is amazing.

Every monster has their own chase theme, which I thought was a thoughtful addition.  

All in all, the game is great. It's a very solid horror game that, at least I think, does not get as much attention as it deserves for what it accomplishes.

36953559.review:
I've been meaning to do this review for a long time, but in all due honesty I don't think there's much I can really talk about when it comes to the differences between this version of [i]Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion[/i] and the original version. I've already made a review of the original version of [i]Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion[/i] here on Steam, so most of what I've said in that there also applies here (but in case you don't want to look for my review of the original game, allow me to sum up the gist of it here: I think the original [i]Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion[/i] is a game that, after first discovering it with a friend via a Markiplier Let's Play and eventually playing it for myself, surprised me in numerous ways in how it handled it's horror and is a title that I continue to enjoy very much even to this day, and is a title that I'd recommend any fan of horror give a try, especially since it'd you nothing to play it.). 

[i]Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion: HD Rennovation[/i] is basically the same game as the original one, albeit with a superior game engine to work with and better models across the board, along with a whole bunch of new rooms and other additions (like full controller support, achievements, and a better options/game configuration menu, to name a few.) that makes this version of the game look and feel more polished and fleshed out than the original. All in all, I consider [i]HD Renovation[/i] to be the definitive edition of [i]Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion[/i]. 

While you can still (as of this writing) play the original version for free here on Steam (or even on sites like Game Jolt), if you liked the original game, I'd recommend getting this version for the reasons stated above and also to support the developers. Veterans of the original game won't be disappointed with this remake.

36945806.review: Will leave some chills, even though it looks friendly

36856021.review:
[h1]Traditional Survival Horror Monsters Hunt You Through Randomly Generated Classic Doom Maps[/h1]


Every time I try to explain this game to friends, they ignore what I say and respond with "[i]I Don't like games that are all about jumpscares, that's not real horror[/i]."  [b]Do you really think a game with a name as on the nose as [u]Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion[/u] to be serious?  The title is ironic.[/b]

Now that I have that out of my system, let's actually start talking about the game.

Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion was originally a free to play game titled Spooky's House of Jump Scares.  Due to some legal drama, they decided to change names.  As the HD Renovation implies, this game is an improved version of that free game.  [b]If you are unsure about buying this game, go ahead and try out the original.  Just be aware that there are a lot of problems that have been fixed in the Renovated version.[/b]  What are some of the changes?  Glad you asked.  The entire game was rebuilt in Unity, meaning it looks and runs smoother.  Controllers have improved support (although remapping on my PS4 controller doesn't seem to work.  Worked around this with Big Picture Mode).  The original game's DLC is provided at no extra cost.  Most importantly, you no longer get stuck trying to turn around corners.

The main gameplay has you wandering a procedurally generated maze, while learning to survive against a variety of monsters.  Along the way, you will pick up notes from previous victims of the mansion, that serve to create a narrative.  About every 50 to 100 rooms, you will find unique rooms that look like they've been pulled from other games or creepy pasta.  For example, you find a room that is textured like Majora's Mask on the N64, and need to deal with a monster that looks like he would be at home in that game.

And about those monsters.  The most fun aspect of the game is learning the patterns of each monster.  Every one of them feels threatening, and some feature unique and disturbing game over screens.  Some monsters will require you to maintain a specific distance from them, while another might require constant eye contact.  While you initially meet each monster in a unique location, they will begin to show up randomly as you progress.  Every monster also has some lore that can be found in game.  It's a nice touch.

Visually, this game is hard to describe.  It blends cute with horrific.  The textures aren't always the best to look at, but it lends character to the setting.  The unique rooms where monsters are introduced are the highlights of the game.  When it comes to audio, this game does things pretty good.  It sets the mood with your typical horror sounds while having some neat tunes for the monsters.  It would have been nice if the soundtrack were included in Renovation, but you can purchase as dlc for the free game.

While I've mainly spoken positively, there are a few complaints I have.  The game can go far too long without anything interesting.  Especially early on, when the game doesn't want to chase you as frequently, but the new monsters are spaced out pretty far apart.  It can get boring when the game generates the same rooms several times in a short amout of time, in particular, when they are long rooms with only one exit.  Going along with repetition, sometimes you'll encounter some monsters a little too frequently.  Also, the game kills you for standing still too long, which is fine, but it's annoying when you die while trying to adjust your settings.

Is this game worth ten dollars?  I don't think it is for everyone.  However, I was willing to pay full price, because I saw how the developers responded to their playerbase.  [b]Albino Moose Games may be the most open and courteous developers I've ever seen.[/b]  I've never seen them speak down to players, and they respond to many of the comments they get.  They have put a ton of work and love into both versions of this game, and I have no problem supporting that.  They are always adding new things, and fixing what breaks.  I really appreciate them.

[b]So, here's the 'skinny:' if you are looking for a game where you learn an increasing number of monster's behaviors, and you don't mind some repetition along the way, this is the game for you![/b]

PS: The Karamari Hospitol DLC is a bit more of a straightforward survival horror experience, featuring it's own set of monsters, if that's what you're looking for.

I liked Spooky's, but I think it could have been crafted better; there's quite a few flaws in its design.

Monsters aren't really a challenge to figure out, and once you do they are pretty trivial.

Monsters aren't really scary - there's certainly a tenseness the first time you face one, but that dwindles in about a room or two.

Overall, I enjoyed Spooky's completely for about 100 rooms.  Then I found I liked about 15 of every 100 rooms from that point - usually when the new monster had shown up.  Every other room is either no monster, or a monster you've figured out before.  Overall the redundancy it relies on for jumpscares hurts the fun overall.

I recommend it, but at a price closer to $2, rather than a full $10; and I also feel like 3-4 hours could be spent better elsewhere.  There's a lot of great games, and this is an alright experience.

*Note : haven't played DLC, but played the entirety of the base game.*

36062061.review: What begins as a tongue-in-cheek parody of horror games takes a sharp turn into a fully-fledged survival horror game reminiscent of over a dozen other games in the genre (such as Clock Tower, Amnesia: The Dark Descent, Dead Space, and Silent Hill). With twenty-three unique monsters spread across three different modes, each offering a different taste of both horror and exploration, the game has quite a bit of longevity given that Endless Mode may very well give you the same monster over and over again. While such a quality is rather irritating, it is offset by the encounters lasting shorter amounts of time (or at the very least, it seems like it) and the mandatory addition of a new monster every 100~ rooms. While it may grow tiresome with some people, those that are willing to put in the time for the slog will be handsomely rewarded with an above-average horror game.

Coming back it still terrifies me. I waltzed through Amnesia:TDD without much worry compared to this. Might just be me, but I very much recommend this game.
Edit: I realize now that this game has scarred me permanantly. After this, being hit is the most jarring thing in any game I play. The flash of red that is so standard in so many games is like a trigger or something for panic for me now. And I have no doubt what game started that.

Before I start my review, you can try out the other version of this game here:

http://store.steampowered.com/app/356670/Spookys_Jump_Scare_Mansion/

Think of it as a demo . Anyways, here's my review of Spooky's Jumpscare Mansion!

This game (originally called Spooky's House of Jumpscares) is a fun, challenging, and scary game set in a mansion. I won't spoil anything in this review so I'll just list my pros and cons below!

Pros:
-The game does an amazing job of doing what it describes in the title!
-There are a total of 1000 rooms with different types of "scares"
-Save points included!
-A completely diferent area of the mansion is accessible through another gamemode
-Endless mode with a leaderboard so you can show off how far you've gotten (my favorite!)
-We got achievements! {Which means I have to beat the game again to get a few...)
-It has VR support
-Multiple different "specimens" to meet!

Cons:
-Not sure if this is intended, but the wooden cardboard cutouts come out of non-existing walls (even in the other version on Steam), like rails. It does however help with the jumpscaring!
-Endless mode can sometimes be a drag with certain rooms

Overall, it's one of my most favorite "horror" games that I enjoy playing. I'll defintely be trying to get a perfect game with this one!

10/10 would get scared by a wooden donut again

[h1]무료판의 재탕, 아기자기하지만 골때리는 게임;[/h1]

이런 분들께 추천합니다. "긴장감이 심한 게임은 싫다", "공포게임은 하고 싶은데 너무 무서운건 싫다".. 이 게임은 게임메이커로 만들어진 저용량 공포 게임입니다. HD Renovation의 경우 아직 무료판에 있는 endless mode는 추가되지 않았습니다. 듣기론 10월 중 업데이트 예정이라죠. 뭐 대부분 퓨디파이 방송을 보고 알게 된 경우가 많을 것이라 생각됩니다. 사실 게임 자체는 아웃 라스트에 여러 캐쥬얼 풍의 느낌을 섞은 독특한 느낌인데 아웃라스트에 비하면 크게 무섭진 않습니다.

물론 겉만보고 무턱대고하다간 뒷통수 강하게 걷어맞는 경우가 생기긴 하겠지만요... 그저 갑툭튀에 떡밥풀이만 *나게 해대는 프레디 피자가게 시리즈에 비하면 훨씬 나은 게임인 것은 틀림없지만 아쉬운 감도 약간 있습니다. HD Renovation를 구매하면 적용되는 Karamari Hospital dlc 의 경우 게임모드가 아니라 그저 게임의 떡밥 풀이에 그쳤다는 점과 스토리 모드 1회차 클리어 이후 endless mode 외엔 정말할게 없다는 점 정도... 또 저와 비슷한 케이스로 [b]더 무서운 게임[/b]을 해보셨던 분들이라면 이 게임은 한번하고 접게 될 가능성이 큽니다. 혹은 스토리 모드 중간에 지루해질 수도 있구요. 

무료판과의 차이는 기존 게임에 적용된 괴물들의 모습이나 각종 텍스쳐 같은게 HD로 개선되거나 수정되었다는 점인데 체감이 크진않지만 무료판에 비해 매끄러워진 건 확실합니다. 10월 업데이트가 되고 endless mode가 추가될 걸 고려해보면 1만원 가격 값어치 이상은 충분히 될거라고 보네요.

33489218.review:
As the title says, SJSM: HD is a graphically updated version of the F2P Spookys Jump scare Mansion with some additional content that the original doesn't have as well as including the dlc from the original. 

The story remains much of the same, a simple seeming facade over a much deeper story with subplots occurring within the mansion that keep you enveloped for all 1000 rooms AND the DLC. With he improvements to some environments, it offers a more in depth feeling that you couldn't get with the first. The places you run through have much more personality and make the story a little better from before.

The graphics are more smoothed out and easier on the eyes from the first, and small details have been added to some rooms (like light rain) which adds nicely to atmosphere. On the other hand, though, most original rooms seem left out of these ambiance updates and remain still night outside, which for me breaks the flow a little bit. I can understand why it's in there, though, since the mansion is so convoluted anyway it does add to that theme. The boss encounters are changed as well, though to avoid anything, I'll leave it at the areas specific to them are revamped significantly too.

I would say try the F2P as a demo of sorts, and if you like it, buy this game because it is the much superior version and supports the devs, who really went above and beyond recreating this game imo.

33140428.review:
I loved the original game and I must say that I am disappointed that it took me so long to buy this version of it.  This game in its nature has more beauty in its animations then its predecessor to the point where I had to stare at my pursuers even as I ran away.  

Specimen 2 alone shocked me with its new animation rising from its puddle.  Specimen 3 got the jump on me as for the first time I saw it fall from the ceiling in front of me (however failing to corner me).  Specimen 4's new school confused me at first, as I expected the rooms to be the same.  Specimen 5's animation alone had me staring for a while.  And so on, and so on.  

I never thought the changes would amaze me so.  Even the note mechanics have changed, allowing for a more realistic and comforting view.  Overall, I would say the changes I witnessed so far make the game generally more difficult.  For example, I used to find comfort in that I would only see Specimen 3 once, as I rarely saw him later in the game.  Now I see all the specimens in a nice even mix that always surprises me.  Even Specimen 2's ink stains nearly caught me off guard before I learned you were slightly faster when you sprinted in them, and Specimens 3 has cornered me at a locked door.

But at the same time, it feels like little has changed, in a good way.  It still has that soft child feel walking in before the fun starts and notes are written word for word.  It feels like the same game, but the next step up.  For example, Calamari Hospital has changed very little overall due to the models already having true animations and 3D builds, but at the same time there are new rooms in the main game which can catch players off guard, such as labs, observation chambers, and what would this house of horrors be without it's occasional door into a wall?

This isn't even a finished game.  If the developers continue as they have, who knows what could be in store for this game?  There are few games I could come back to repeatedly such as this one's predecessor.  This even already brags of a mansion editor.  Do I hear "Steam Workshop Content?"  The one thing I can say against this is that now you can't dissect the files, removing any hope of a fan-made texture pack.  Then again, "Spooky's Middle Earth" may not have been a good idea in the long run...

I hope to enjoy more of this game in the long run.

33065857.review:
This is essentially an enhanced remaster of Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion. Much of the same things apply -- if you liked Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion, you'll like the HD Renovation.

The remaster changed a few essentials.

- All specimen have 3D models now, except for Howard and the jukebox monster in Specimen 8's domain.
- Health, instead of regenerating at a constant rate of 1 per second, now rapidly regenerates after about ~6 seconds of not being damaged.
- The ability to turn off all Specimen chases, or all Specimen 1 instances (the pop-outs)
- Axe can no longer be rapid swung (:c)

There's a few other changes, but ultimately, this is just a repaint of Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion. If you liked the original, and you have money to spare, there's no reason you wouldn't like this game.

As per why I love this game, it's pretty simple. It's adorable.

I haven't played much of the HD version, but I have noticed something that bothered me in the original.

In the original, I did a lot of strafing. I played a lot of Doom growing up and if I can strafe, you better believe that I will.

In any case, I noticed, in the original, I would get caught on the walls or edges when I would strafe. This caused me to get hurt by the various specimens running about.

Now that's not an issue. It's almost as though my character has a nice coating of Crisco, allowing them to glide freely along the walls to their heart's content as opposed to the velcro that was before.

That was a long way to say, I love this game, and I am looking forward to be jumpscared by a slice of bread... again.

I made a review of the original, and I said I liked it, but didn't get far, as I was too spooked. Oh, how you can grow in a year...

This game is great. It is surprisingly scary, and very addictive, as it is completely random aside from the set encounters. So, what is this game? It is... well... you know those "haunted houses" that used to be held by your school, that weren't really scary? Well, this game is like one of those, but actually scary. Very scary to be in fact!

So many people said that I would lose my crap over FNaF, but that game was just boring to me, dispite a few moments that creeped me out. No, this game is MUCH better!

Each specimen is a representative from a horror genre, and as someone who is a fan of Horror movie tropes, it was just a fun time.

I was going to end the review off here... but... then came endless mode... and HOLY SH*T! This game's difficulty went from 0-100! Not only can the old specimins respawn, sometimes multiple at once, but also there is an entire boat load of new enemies which can, in some occasions, be extremely difficult. And I do mean Extremely. Either way, it is a blast to play, and truly made this game worth re-playing. Now I am just waiting for build-a-mansion. That will be fun.

7/10. Very Good!

Other than a few hiccups that could honestly be blamed on Unity for being Unity, this is a pretty solid game and an excellent recreation of the original. It's better in every way possible, except for the death screens, which are not nearly as smooth. Hopefully that'll get fixed soon but anyhow, I have a message I want to direct to some of you people.

Yes, this game is harder than the original. The specimen have actually been balanced, where-as the original was more just a bunch of concepts tossed into a really bad sandbox. Especially Endless Mode, it's been severely revamped to the point of posing an actual, genuine challenge. Don't be that idiot who goes "WOW THE DEVS SUCK WTF MAN THIS GAME IS JUST BAD U RUINED IT" because you suck at a game. You need to re-learn some of the specimen and you need to actually get good, a concept some people seem to have trouble wrapping their head around.

Is this a perfect game? Absolutely not, I love it and all but it's certainly nothing to start wars over. It's just a cute and fun little game that's really nice to play, especially given the current state of gaming. Worth the price? It could honestly be charged for more and I'd be fine with it. If you liked the original, you're going to love this one.

Я постараюсь сделать достаточно детальный обзорна на этот ремастеред, если его можно так назвать, и не буду затрагивать вещи, как халява/цена, карточки и прочее. Так что не бойтесь размера текста. 
Начнем с оригинала. Игрушка была чем-то новым для меня. В ней был обманчивый внешний вид, простенькая графика, страх, ужасы  и главное - оригинальность. Представьте, что вы посмотрели фильм Хижина в лесу и превратили. Так было создано поместье Спуки. Просто сделали 1000 комнат, где можно встретить монстров из различных игр, крипипаст, добавили немного милоты, отшлейфовали и готово.  
А теперь поговорим о новом виде игры. Начнем с новинок. Графику немного улучшили, что радует глаза,
 хоть и оставили фичу, что 2d объекты всеравно смотрят вам в лицо. Добавили новые комнаты. Есть лестницы. Новый игровой автомат. И теперь можно открывать двери задницей. Фича прикольная, так как может немного помочь с прохождением против куклы и можно посмотреть на своего преследователя, если дажеко от него оторвался и ждешь у двери. Но хорошего не так уж и много. 
Помните те картонки, которые выпрыгивают из стен с кавайной улыбкой? Помните как часто они выпрвгивали в классической версии? А теперь представьте, что в этой версии, шанс их встретить 1 картонка  к 20 комнатам. При том, не всегда эти всречи и способны испугать. Довольно часто встречаются темные комнаты с разными путями, просто раздражают. И про белые комнаты, где надо по звукам понять правильную дорогу. Вы можете встретить такие от силы штук 5. Новый игровой автомат скучен и не понятен. Мелочь, а не приятно. Про меню настроек и русский в игре даже говорить не хочется. 
Так каковы плюсы: Улучшеная картинка. Новые комнаты. Длс. Запуск на окулусе. 
Минусы: Не много-то и изменили, по сути. Да и страшно теперь только на половину. 
Так что решайте сами. Любите вы хорроры или нет. Покупать ее для себя или для друга. И достойна ли сама игра такого.

30740305.review:
Alright, I'll say it: I have a strange love for this game for a reason unknown to me. I've been with SJSM since the beginning, the good old days when it had a correct title (Spooky's House of Jump Scares) and had not fallen prey to a group of ignorant German developers who make unoriginal mobile games. Man, that was awful.

But anyway, onto the review. Now I already said I love this game, but for God's sake, don't make me pay $10 just to play it again with slightly better lighting and 3D models! When the remake was first announced, I was super excited, and all of the pre-release footage looked great.

And then came the waiting. The game was supposed to be released on December 25, 2016. It got pushed to February 17, 2017, which I was okay with. If the game needs improvements, let it have its improvements. But when February 17 came around, it got delayed AGAIN to February 24. I was disappointed, but waited patiently. And then it happened AGAIN, delayed to March 1. At this point I was at my limit, but I was happy to see it was finally released on March 1st.

I installed it, eagerly pressed play, and expected miracles. Here's where the REAL review begins.

First of all, the main menu is a HUGE step up from what it previously was. In the old version, you could only use arrow keys to select things on menus, but now mouse support has been added, along with the main menu's background being completely recreated in 3D, which I personally found awesome.

But then, (sigh), I actually started playing the game itself. My first disappointment came from the fact that Spooky didn't have her own 3D model. I guess they said that SPECIMEN would get 3D models, and never mentioned Spooky, but come on. She's practically the game's mascot, for crying out loud. So I pushed that thought aside and began running through the 1000 rooms. After about 100 rooms through, it hit me.

[i]It's exactly the same as the old version.[/i]

Well, not EXACTLY. For example, there are new rooms, the Specimen have 3D models, lighting has been drastically improved on, but it just didn't satisfy me! As I sped through the rooms, I ranted on and on about stupid little details the *awesome* devs could have added. Color interpolation between pixels! How the sprinting speed had been slightly slowed! And the only other thing in the game that's even REMOTELY close to something you couldn't create with GameObjects in Unity is the Brain Room (which is the kind of quality I expected from the rest of the game). tl;dr, the game was too simple for Unity.

There are some really good-looking games that run on Unity. The Forest, Stranded Deep, Cities: Skylines... but all I see in the SJSM: HD Renovation is cubes and an occasional cylinder. I know there's one more DLC coming for the game, and I really hope it's as good (if not better, and somewhat longer) than Karamari Hospital. Oh, and for everyone's sakes, make use of more 3D models, like in KH. The ones in KH were lowpoly, sure, but they were clearly not cubes.

But I suppose I've said enough bad stuff about a game I sincerely love. Specimen 6 is a little more challenging than before. I like that. The 3D models for the specimen are great, Specimen 2 looks awesome (if not a bit taller than it originally was) Specimen 3 is the perfect balance between scary and hilarious, Specimen 4 takes on a revamped look, 5 fits with the area's theme perfectly, 6 looks perfect... I could carry on for a long time.

So basically, what I'm saying is this: if you're interested in the game and want to try it out, get the free version and buy Karamari Hospital. You're getting pretty much the same game with an astounding DLC that the HD Renovation doesn't currently support. If you end up really liking the game, than go ahead and buy the HD Renovation--just don't expect many new things at all besides a new DLC that should be arriving some time in the next 100 years (that's the best estimate I can make ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ ).

And before I go, let me just state again that I really, truly admire this game in all ways possible--its story, art style, gameplay, etc. It's just that this version didn't quite deliver what I had in mind, but from reading all of their posts and updates, I can see that they went through some serious crap to get this version up and going. So many kudos to them for that.

Just remember, you two... that next DLC. It BETTER be good.





P.S. Next time you guys make an amazing game, don't cram 2 billion files into one asset package. I have a strange obsession for looking at game files, but I can't with this game because Unity Assets Explorer can't handle all those files.

P.S.S. And don't worry, I'm not going to do anything bad with the files. It's just for fun and games and leraning purposes ;)

30736043.review:
After 17.3 Hours and probably More after this Review,it's finally Time to do a Review on this Game!

This Review was written on March 25th 2017.Some Content might have Changed or some Bugs might have been fixed later on.

[h1] GAMEPLAY: [/h1]
The Game has some pretty Addicting Gameplay.You basically go from Room to Room,open one Door to the Other until you Reach Room 1000.But that ain't it.SPOILERS AHEAD : [spoiler] Every 10 Rooms after you reach an Elevator,you encounter every 50 or 100 Rooms, [/spoiler] you encounter a New Creature,we all know as [spoiler] "Specimen" [/spoiler].They chase you Down and they try to Kill you.It's Randomized,when you Encounter them [spoiler] Except for,where you meet them.And did i mention,that there was a Boss fight?Look for Yourself! [/spoiler]

[h1] NEW DIffERENCES fROM THE ORIGINAL GAME: [/h1]
All Monsters are 3D Modelled,the Textures are HD and Improved.There are actual Options now,including Button Settings,Controller Supoort,field of View,VR Support,etc.That's all,you need to Know,really.

[h1] WILL YOU LIKE IT? / IS IT WORTH THE MONEY?: [/h1]
Well,i can't really Answer that.There is always the free Original Version,so,go try that out to Hit a Decision! It's free to Download on Steam too! In my personal Opinion,it definitely is Worth every Cent.I mean,for 10$,you get an amazing Singleplayer Horror Experience,Steam Cards,upcoming Achievements,upcoming DLCs and Endings AND upcoming Custom Levels!

[h1] PROS AND CONS IN TOTAL: [/h1]
-It gets very Repetitive sometimes with the Rooms,since the Game is randomly Generated.
-There are still some Glitches,but the Developers are trying their Best to fix them all,so,that's a +!
-There is no real Backstory and/or Objective,except for "Make it to Room 1000 and don't Die.".
-The Lack of Replayability of the Campaign Mode. (Still waiting for Endless Mode)
-You can Turn Monsters and Jumpscares off.Seriously,why is it called "Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion",if you can turn everything Scary or Creepy off?

+Charming Artstyle
+Amazing Atmosphere
+Suprising Moments
+"Troll" Moments
+Nice,but not perfect Gameplay
+Definitely gets you Scared at some Point.
+Pretty Addictive
+Amazing Community and Active Developers
+Many upcoming features and Gamemodes

[h1]  MY TOTAL RATING : 7/10 [/h1]
In my Opinion,it's not Perfect,but still worth a Shot.So,go ahead!Give it a Try! :)

The rest is about the mansion, told by various notes, Spooky herself, or by other means. Other than knowing others have ventured in before, you get information on the monsters called Specimens with their respected number. If you are going to encounter it, there will be a note from someone who came into contact with it. Every once in a while a computer will show up, CAT_DOS, that has files on the specimens. Whether if they are active, the method they use to kill, fatalities they caused, and a brief history on them.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion no doubt has a slow build-up. Going through around 100 rooms picking up the occasional note or Specimen 1, the cutout, popping out. Essentially bringing in the sense of the mansion not being as dangerous as it seems...until the dangerous specimens come out and play. Specimen 2 is used as a way to show how the Specimens will generally work. You do have an option to turn off jumpscares and Specimens if you are too scares or just want to go through the story without Specimens getting in the way.

To put it simply, running through rooms is most of the gameplay, it is simplistic but charming the way it was worked in. The main rooms you will see is jumbled up and randomly selected with some being exceptions. These exceptions being Specimen specific rooms, save rooms, or a variety based on whether or not you are being chased. Of course, deep in you will be speeding through these rooms but it is nice to see a lot of variety they put into the rooms, especially with the new designed ones in this HD version.

Every Specimen will be encountered at least once in their respective room than a chance to show up later. Each having their own queue of music, having a 50% chance of activating, and static with some Specimens. Once they become aware of you, Specimens will show what they are made of with the gimmicks they have. Most somewhat having some way of inhibiting your movement while others wastes no time to show you their own death screen. Such as Specimen 2 (Ink Boy) leaving Ink that slows you down and Specimen 6 (Happy Puppet Salesman) only attacking when you are not looking at him but he can certainly leave and appear behind you. Only two is area specific, so rest easy as only 10 will follow. Along with Specimens are minor enemies. While these are far and few between, these do play a part in the lore.

Each Specimen is inspired by something, whether it is something broad or narrowed down to one game or source. The most recognizable being Specimen 4 (Ringu),  inspired by Japanese horror and RPGs like Corpse Party or Ju-on: The Grudge, and Specimen 6, inspired by The Legend of Zelda Majora's Mask sharing expressions of the Mask Salesman and referencing Ben Drowned in it's backstory.

Lastly, the minigames have appeared in the mansion! These minigames appear as three arcade machines featuring Spooky. One similar to Pac-Man (Mrs. Spook), one similar to Mario Kart (Spooky Kart), and is just killing as many people you want to before a meter runs out (Mall of Spook). The last one? That's a secret you have to figure out.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The soundtrack is great. There is about three distinguishable tracks when not being chased and they fit ambience of the mansion very well. Cycling them in a way that makes you suspicious of your surroundings as you go deeper. The Specimen soundtracks can be forgettable, especially when you do not encounter them for the remainder of the game or till way later. There are some that stick in your head such as Specimen 8's (Deer God) and Specimen 4's but you will generally know a Specimen is after you based on the music change or getting hit.

The sound effects do seem to go on the realistic side. From doors opening to being attacked sounds, or close to, what it would probably sound like. Especially the clicks of Specimen 3 creeping on you.

[h1]Art Style[/h1]
With switching from Gamemaker 8 to Unity more creativity can flow into the game. We have some new rooms and new lighting to work. I do find weird the bones are the same 2d graphics, but the Specimens are the main attraction. While some still have a 2d feel, they have been improved by the colors. The already 3d Specimens do have more of that feel in this version. More body to work with. One of the most noticeable is Specimen 11 (Burger Demon) that seems to have a crown of fire since we last saw it.

[h1]Performance[/h1]
Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion: HD Renovation performs quite well despite the change of game engines. There is only one thing, the sensitivity for controllers does not change despite changing the settings for it.

[h1]Replayability[/h1]
Right now, replayability is dependent on how much the player wants to see. If you want to see all the endings, see all the death screens, or find all the secrets you can easy get close or to there with passwords. These passwords certainly encourages you to replay which is greatly appreciated with how many floors there are to go through.

Karamari Hospital, Endless Mode, and Build Your Own Mansion is planned to be implemented sometime in the near future to add more replayability. I'm sure I am not the only one waiting anxiously to see it in the renovation.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
+ Soundtrack
+ Specimen creativity
+ Charming gameplay

+/- Has that feel of being in Early Access (partly due to features available in the original not being available at first such as the minigames)

Whether it be the HD Renovation or the original, Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion is a great game. When I heard it was going to be remade, I was enthusiastic as I loved the original but never got around playing the dlc or added content. If you are on the rope for the renovation, you can always play the original and can wait for the additional content to be added, one being dlc. The dev team is wonderful as they work to fix bugs as soon as they can, most being solved by the time I started playing, and interact with their fanbase. I highly recommend Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion: HD Renovation and go through all 1,000 floors yourself.

Let's just hope Specimen 6 shows up only once in a playthrough...

30519884.review:
Having just completed the base game, I can say it's fun, the scares aren't limited to the "jump" variety, and there's more to it than just sprinting to the next door.

First of all, the graphics are minimalistic without feeling primitive or unfinished. Things you can interact with in the rooms are fairly obvious, and I never felt like I was lost or stuck. There always seems to be a way forward just nearby, and the game just flows in a satisfying way without becoming monotonous.

The checkpoint system is such that you will sometimes, though not excessively, have to play through a large area repeatedly. The specimens (enemies) can sometimes be tricky to avoid, and I got frustrated a few times when I thought I was doing it right. There are hints scattered around the rooms on how to handle each one.

The music is excellent but not intrusive. Music transitions from room to room, and is not merely atmospheric. There are intermittent ambient noises. Each specimen has a musical theme, and one in particular utters threatening taunts. Jumpscares are accompanied by scary, bizarre or funny sounds.

I played with a controller. There are annoyances when trying to select menu items. I had to tap the stick back and forth to highlight something. Moving, turning, and strafing in first-person is very fluid, and you will be doing a lot of all three.

The game actually is scary, though somehow also relaxing and hypnotic. There are nods to games like Silent Hill, Amnesia, Alien, and probably others I didn't catch.

Just as I began to think I'd seen all the game had to offer, it offered a surprise or joke that piqued my interest again. I thought the ending was okay. It's not exactly memorable, but the journey was worth it.

Is it worth $10 when you can play a free version? I think so. This is not a "let's watch a let's play" kind of game. You should experience it for yourself. More free content is promised, and I'd like to support any future games.

As for the creatures themselves most are just humanoid entity running toward you and hurting you when close enought. There is some escalations in the power of the monster which make you fear what the next part of the maze hold. But after the puppet, you realize that no monsters even come close to being as dangerous and that the new gimmicks are just filters over the screen or are just massively slowing you down. For exemple, there's some creature which you have to stay close to, or else it go insane and start to go extremly fast. It could be interessing if this monster was moving erratically and you had to pay attention to its movement, or if he was paired with another monster, but since it keep moving at the same slugish speed, this just make the whole thing tedious instead of scary.

Maybe the hospital and future update will change my opinion about this game but I doubt it.

30352669.review:
I'm a huge fan of Spooky's. I loved the original and was blown away by how good the Karamari Hospital DLC is.
But... this left me disappointed.
I support the developer on Patreon, and so have received regular updates about this "HD remake", and this led me to have much higher hopes.
It honestly just feels like a mod. A good mod, don't get me wrong, but it doesn't feel like it's changed enough to warrant repackaging & selling.
It honestly feels like the same deal as Overwatch - paying for an incomplete, early-access game branded as complete.
Spooky's is one of my all-time favourite horror games that still scares me even today, but the problem with this "HD remake" is that while it does add some new things, it also breaks other things and leaves them incomplete, and what it does well has the unfortunate side-effect of making those screwups all the more glaring.

Only a few specimens have been updated with new models, but this doesn't exactly matter as the chases are still repetitive and give you next to no reason to ever turn around and look at what's chasing you, and they pretty much all kill you in the same way - a few scratches popping up on the screen to indicate damage. Just run, and you're fine. You could go a whole playthrough never looking at more than one or two specimens.
A good way to solve this would be to make 3D models for EVERY specimen, then add some form of puzzles or even just key-hunting, to give an element of panic. Also, make all the specimens move faster. They don't have to all move as fast as Specimen 3, but they should all at least have varying speeds higher than that of the player's walking speed. It makes no sense that you can outwalk them; you could get a good feeling of pressure by forcing us to ration our stamina for sprinting away.
The Amnesia puzzle? Figuring out hiding spots and getting the keys in Specimen 12? Those were great; do more of that! Especially in the school, where you clearly put in effort making larger rooms.
Also, Specimen 10's 2nd form moves TOO fast. Slow him down just a little bit.
The specimens in general need to have a reason for us to be afraid, not just because "the sprite / model is sliding toward you and will scratch you to death". We have to be in more of a panic to get away from them, but simply sprinting through room after room and never looking at them gets very old very fast.

The rooms have been updated, and some - especially the new ones - look very nice. However, this also doesn't matter as there is still no point to looking at anything. You can just run through a room and click any door, and it won't make a difference. My suggestion to fix this would be to have more interactivity or puzzles, or to have every door in a room be slightly different to give you a rough idea of what to expect in the next room. For example, either a specimen chase or a puzzle to solve, or a completely random room like what every door currently does.

Several elements of the game have also been either removed or broken entirely.
For example: When in the Silent Hill area, there's a room with an unexplained sperm-like sprite. In the original game, this thing would thrash around with the demonic sound of a shrieking baby. It was VERY disturbing. But in this version of the game, the sprite just sits there not doing anything.
Also when Specimen 12 is patrolling the rooms, you used to be able to tell via an audio cue when he had entered & left, so you knew when it was safe to leave. That's no longer the case. When you're hiding in the tunnels, he used to have a fairly audible whisper that was quite haunting. That's gone. When he chases you toward the end, he also used to have a terrifying wail before the chase began. That's also gone.

In its current form, I cannot recommend this HD version of Spooky's.
When it's seen some updates, if the problems have been fixed, I'll replay it and perhaps update my review to recommend it, but as it is, can't recommend.
BUT - I do want the developer to be supported, so my advice to players would be to get the original free version on Steam, then buy the Karamari Hospital DLC. You won't be disappointed.
Also, consider supporting the developer on his Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/AlbinoMoose

30312431.review:
Эта игра чистый "симулятор ходьбы". Кроме как бегать по бесконечным коридорам, в ней делать нечего. При этом непонятно, чем пытается казаться эта игра - ужастиком или "няшным" ужастиком. В игре много "няшных" картин с изображением кошечек и улыбающихся чашечек с кофем. При этом есть и экземпляры на которых изображено нечто ужасное, что даже напоминает картины из серии игр "Silent Hill". Кстати о Silent Hill... В игре есть локация до боли похожая на локацию подвала в альтернативной больнице из первой Silent Hill. Судите сами - все обгоревшее, пол и стены выполнены из заржавевшего металла, в комнатах можно найти растянутые человеческие кожи. Так же присутствует жуткая школа, что символизирует любовь японцев к ужастикам в школах. В основном локации это бесконечно повторяющиеся копипасты одних и тех же комнат и коридоров. Иногда меняются только текстуры стен. Так что готовьтесь к скучному времяпровождению. Иногда из стен будут выскакивать всякие картонные картинки монстриков, печенек и прочая няшная чертовщина прямо как на атракционнах ужасов с вагонеткой. Казалось бы, чему тут бояться? Ну выскочило из стены изображение грустного хлебушка, чего тут такого? А суть такова - когда наступает момент, вас начинает преследовать монстр, и вы автоматом бежите, и внезапно из стены улыбающийся кофеек появляется! За счет такой ниожиданности можно припугнуться, но не произвести кирпич. Говоря о монстрах, их модели до ужаса простенькие. Есть чисто спрайтовые и простенькие 3D-модели, с анимацией и без. Суть борьбы с ними - просто бежать вперед! И все! Тут нет ничего сложного. Проиграть в этой игре очень сложно.
Хочу отдельно отметить винрарный саундтрек! Наверное, это самый большой плюс в игре! Саундтрек настолько атмосферный, что только за счет него хочется продолжать играть.
Почему я не рекомендую эту игру? Да потаму, что она очень скучная! Серьезно, вы хотите просто бегать по одним и тем же пустым коридорам? Иногда будут попадаться локации не похожие на другие, но это будут единичные случаи по сложности как тетрис на первой скорости. Даже про сюжет нечего сказать. Он здесь для галочки. В общем, мне игра не понравилась.

30303361.review:
Я помню как сильно я обрадовался когда нашел классическую версию этой игры в стиме после того как посмотрел видос на ютубе. И сейчас я еще сильнее обрадовался тому, что случайно наткнулся на нее в стиме. Да еще и в HD.
Что нужно знать об этой игре? Вы бежите из комнаты в комнату, в которых Вас всячески пытаются напугать. Причем делается это и скримерами, и преследующими монстрами, и очень жуткой атмосферой, и, э, "Пугалками". 
Дело в том, что то, что Вас в этой игре пугает варьируется от очень милого и забавного до зап*здрически жуткого. В одной комнате, пока вы сломя голову бежите к другой двери, из стены может выскочить милая фигурка из картона в виде тостика, пенька, тыквы и т.д. А в другой комнате за Вами может начать гнаться какой-то жуткий зеленый хрен. А потом, когда вы открыли очередную дверь, вы оказываетесь в темной школе со страшными звуками или же в каких-то пыточных камерах, как в сайлент хиле. А можете вообще оказаться в макдоналдсе с Сатаной (не шучу). Причем надо отметить, что разработчики не пытаются напугать игрока на каждом шагу, а делают это постепенно, с интервалами, иногда во время напряженной ситуации выскакивающий улыбающийся пенек напугает Вас и заставит бояться еще сильнее. В общем, пугают тут очень и очень грамотно.
Стоит ли эта игра своих денег? Определенно. Отличается ли она от бесплатного оригинала? Да, и даже очень: улучшенная графика, приятная музыка, новые монстры - все говорит о том, что разрабы действительно старались и душу вложили в игру.
Я вот игру взял сразу же не раздумывая как только увидел. И ни разу не пожалел.
Если вы хотите скоротать время и качественно пощекотать себе нервы, то игра однозначно для Вас!

Where do I even begin.
Well for those unaware, this is a remake of the really cool game called Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion. The new features that are added bring the experience of actually not having to use a mouse and keyboard and being able to run the game on a Intel laptop. (For me that is.)

And what I love about HD Renovation is how it still feels and plays the same as before, why fix what isn't broken right?

However, there are a few things I need to mention which may contain spoilers.



I have a feeling that this game isn't really "HD" because the textures mostly look the same as before but blurrier.

My last few nitpicks is the options menu, I feel that it may throw people off balance because of how confusing it is but then again I'm happy to have these options. Also is it just me or does the fact that there's an option of taking away the jumpscares and specimen completely ruin the experience for me?


But enough of my complaints.
TDLR; This is a worthy purchase if you love the game and want a good ride of nostalgia.

这是之前那个恐怖游戏【1000吓人屋】的高清版，光影和材质方面都有提升，也加入了很多之前没见过的房间，不知道是错觉还是什么，总感觉怪物的速度好像都有加强，让游戏感觉更加紧张了。
    游戏：玩家只需在这房子里走走路，玩玩游戏机，躲躲怪，开开房间就行了，中途会遇到突然吓你一跳的元素【而且很多】，游戏内的地图还挺丰富的，像实验室，学校，古庙什么的，每一张特殊地图也代表了每一个特殊的怪，也更有让人走下去的动力【实际上大多数的房间还是因为有怪物在追我所以过得特别快23333】
    音效：说实话还真的挺吓人的，光听着自己的脚步声开开房间都觉得慌得不行，更别说突然有东西吓你一跳，虽然大多数是一些特别萌的纸板蹦出来，但那蹦出来时出现的音效着实能把我吓得跳起来【音效还有不同，运气好只是柔和的钢琴声，运气不好......只能自己感受了】
画面：说画面的话其实还挺精细的，一种看上去特别可爱的像素风【当你看见怪就不会这么想了】，我也没什么可挑剔的，看起来也感觉特别舒服，大晚上一个人关灯玩也不伤眼【哈哈哈哈哈哈哈，然而并不敢】
  总体来说游戏是不错的，没玩过的话可以去玩玩看它的免费版【Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion】，要是玩过前作的话建议可以入一个，感受一下全新的惊吓体验~ 价格也挺亲民的，这一作不仅加入了关卡制作器还支持了VR设备，没的说，好评10/10~
PS：目前只有剧情模式，关卡制作器和前作的DLC【Karamari医院】在后续更新会加入到游戏中，想玩的话建议趁现在打折入了后再等更新，目前史低是24
PPS：Spooky好萌~~~

30270443.review:
[This review has been updated!]

Played through the entire HD Renovation and thought I'd explain some new stuff and changes. First of all, anyone that is a fan of the original Spooky's Jump Scare Mansion already knows that the game plays exactly the same. 

Specimen Changes:

Specimen 1: When the player chops one of the cardboard cutouts, it gently falls to the ground.
Specimen 2: Specimen 2 now emerges from the pool of goop instead of spawning from the opposite door. In addition, Specimen 2 also seems to go faster, and the pool of goop slows the player down considerably. 
Specimen 3: Specimen 3 has a graphical update and is now extremely fast. When it attacks the player it recedes a few feet back before resuming the chase. In addition, it can spawn from any hole in the ceiling. Immune to the axe.
Specimen 4: Specimen 4's scripted room has been extended to include more lockers. more (locked) rooms and is now two stories. Specimen 4 is notably transparent with black lines and has a noticeable shadow around her figure.
Specimen 5: Specimen 5 plays pretty much the same, although it moves slightly faster and it actually busts down the doors instead of opening it. The fog effect has been removed.
Specimen 6: Specimen 6 plays pretty much the same, although it seeingly spawns faster if the player isn't looking backwards. In addition, if Specimen 6 spawns in the room and stays there for a short period of time the strings attached to it will launch it up in the air and randomly land on the player. Immune to the axe.
Specimen 7: Specimen 7's rooms are now a much darker red. 
Specimen 8: Very slow (you can outwalk it).
Specimen 9: No noticeable changes.
Specimen 10: Graphical updates and moves slightly faster.
Specimen 11: Graphical updates and moves slightly slower. Immune to the axe.
Specimen 12: Graphical updates and moves slightly faster.
Specimen 13: Graphical updates.

-the HUD is fixed in one area of screen and doesnt float around when rotating your head
-you NEED to use a controller (its much harder with m+kb) to move around and the joystick sensitivy is way too high
-you can't modfiy game settings using a control (I had to use keyboard just to adjust the settings)
